text.*:
This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.

This is a list of mascots. A mascot is any person, animal, or object thought to bring luck, or anything used to represent a group with a common public identity, such as a school, professional sports team, society, military unit, or brand name.

Contents

  • 1 College
  • 2 Computing
  • 3 Sports
    • 3.1 Olympics
    • 3.2 Major League Baseball
    • 3.3 National Football League
    • 3.4 National Hockey League
    • 3.5 National Basketball Association
    • 3.6 Association Football
  • 4 Music
  • 5 Magazines
  • 6 See also
  • 7 References

Music[edit]

  • Violent Mind is the mascot for the German thrash metal band Kreator[1][2]
  • "The Halloween Guy" is the mascot of the German thrash metal band Exumer[3]
  • OD is the mascot for the American thrash metal band Sacred Reich[4]
  • Flotzilla (also known as Flossie the Sea Monster) is the mascot of the American thrash metal band Flotsam & Jetsam[5]
  • Bill Z. Bubb is the mascot of the American glam metal band Dangerous Toys[6]
  • Heartbeast is the mascot of the Canadian death metal band Kataklysm[7]

Magazines[edit]

  • Astérix - Pilote. [8] [9]
  • César the crow.[10] Since 2010 Grrreeny the tiger - Wapiti.[11]
  • Le Chat - Le Soir [12]
  • Claire - Flair. [13]
  • Eppo - Eppo [14]
  • Luc Junior - La Libre Junior, the children's supplement of La Libre Belgique. [15] [16]
  • De Lustige Kapoentjes - 't Kapoentje. [17] [18]
  • Alfred E. Neuman - Mad Magazine. [19]
  • Pif le chien - Pif Gadget. [20]
  • Playboy Bunny - Playboy [21]
  • Tobias Quintenpreut - De Vrije Balloen. [22]
  • Rikske en Fikske - Zonnekind [23]
  • Samir - Samir. [24]
  • Spirou - Spirou [25]
  • Eustace Tilley - The New Yorker. [26]
  • Tina - Tina (the original character was designed by Andries Brandt [27] and Purita Campos [28] in 1973 and used until 2010, after which she was remodelled into a different girl character with the same name in 2013 by Jan Vriends.)[29]
  • Tintin - Le Petit Vingtième, Tintin. [30]
  • Weatherbird - St. Louis Dispatch. [31]
